ground_truth: She heads back inside, studying the unopened letter, and goes to knock on the door of Mr. Bennet's study. She goes inside and hands over the letter. Mr. Bennet leaves the letter on the desk until the housekeeper has left. The housekeeper now makes her way out into the garden to take down the washing. Jane and Lizzie are picking fruit. Lizzie puts down her basket and rushes off, quickly followed by Jane. The two girls hurry around the outside of the house, then across the wide expanse of lawn, looking for their father. They spot him, arms behind his back, strolling pensively into the shade of the trees. They rush over to him. Lizzie sits down with the letter. Lizzie stands up, looking perturbed. Later, Lizzie's in Jane's bedroom in her nightgown.
